required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunoglobulin G Antibody Immune Response Profile Following Infection With SARS-CoV-2 in COVID-19 Egyptian Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Immunoglobulin G Antibody Immune Response Profile Following Infection With SARS-CoV-2 in COVID-19 Egyptian Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to detect the evidence on the immune response following acute SARS-CoV-2 infections. the study will report the profile of IgG specific antibodies levels to SARS-CoV-2 infection found in recovered coronavirus disease (COVID-19) patients after infection for both symptomatic and asymptomatic patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
A total of 30 COVID-19 patients for the study will be enrolled. All the patients enrolled were confirmed to be infected with SARS-CoV-2 by RT-PCR assay for nasal and pharyngeal swab specimens.
For the study, serum samples of the 30 patients will be collected and will be investigated for the detection rate for immunoglobulin G (IgG). The first sample will be collected 2 weeks after the second negative RT-PCR assay for nasal and pharyngeal swab specimens and 6 samples will be collected after that for 6 months later; one serum sample tested every month for 6 months after.
The following questions will be addressed:-
1. What proportion of confirmed cases develops specific IgG antibodies to SARS-CoV-2?
2. How long is the duration of detection of serum IgG antibodies and antibody titres over time following infection with SARS-CoV-2?

primary_outcome.description: it's expected to have COVID-19 antibodies within 1month of infection the antibody titre expected to rise the fall to a lower levels

study_pop.textblock: patients attending sohag university hospital and have recent COVID -19 infection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with recent COVID- 19 infection(2 weeks after the second negative RT-PCR assay)
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients on immune-suppressive therapy
- patients with immunological disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: assistant professor of medical microbiology and immunology at sohag faculty of medicine fa
